comments.body:
So what happens here in this somewhat cryptic code:

1) `for /f` - is used for processing text by breaking the line up into individual items of data called 'tokens'. By default breaks occur at a space character.
2) `"tokens=1-2*"` - this specifies that the first 2 parameters in our text should be allocated to the first 2 letters, i.e "%%a" and "%%b" and the asterisk specifies that the remaining parameters should be allocated to the letter "%%c".
3) `%%a` - a replaceable parameter. We start at "%%a" for the first parameter, then "%%b" for the second and so on.
4) `in ("%*")` - text string that we are processing

More details on: https://ss64.com/nt/for_f.html
